knimeNode.name: Deploy R Model to MSSQL
knimeNode.shortDescription: Run R code with a pre-trained R model on a Microsoft SQL Server in a database.

fullDescription.intro: This node allows running R code on a Microsoft SQL Server (using a SQL query behind the scenes). Input and output data to the R script are SQL tables. In addition the knime.model and knime.flow.in variables from a R port can be used in the R script.

tab.name: R Editor
tab.option: Name of the SQL table which knime.out will be written to.
The code being executed in R. Input data is available as a data frame named knime.in.

tab.name: Templates
tab.option: A template category defined by the author.
A brief overview of the purpose of the template.
The code to be applied to your expression editor.

ports.inPort: Connection to a Microsoft SQL Database

views.view: The text sent to standard out during the execution of R executable as well as the text of the .Rout file generated by R.

The text sent to standard error during the execution of R executable as well as the text of the .Rout file generated by R. (If it appears in gray, it's the output of a previously failing run which is preserved for your trouble shooting.)
